channel.title: Cookies on Lisa's Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in Cookies on Lisa's Notebook

item.title: Elmo, the Cookie Monster, and Epistemic Injustice
item.description: Last night at Philsoc I had cause to bring up a fascinating piece of research. ⊕ Jackson J.E., Green L. (2005) Tense and Aspectual be in Child African American English. In: Verkuyl H.J., de Swart H., van Hout A. (eds) Perspectives on Aspect. Studies in Theoretical Psycholinguistics, vol 32. Springer, Dordrecht Janice E. Jackson and Lisa Green conducted research on a group of primary school students in Massachusetts. Some of the students were white, some black.
